intro: Hemimunroa andina var. breviseta, commonly known as the Andean short-stemmed hemimunroa, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with short, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white, and it produces small, triangular fruits. This species is adapted to cold, mountainous environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
